info.title: Kallabot API
info.description: Production OpenAPI for Kallabot — Create Voice AI Agent API

AgentRequest.description: Request payload for creating an agent

system_prompt.example: You are a proactive helpfull AI Voice Agent which has access to [input your tools] and can help the customer with information/by doing tasks for them within your capacity. If there is anything you cannot help the customer with then decline or suggest a call transfer to a human agent.

Llm.title: LLM
Llm.description: LLM configuration: choose either the OpenAI-only option or the LiteLLM/multi-provider option.

OpenAiOnlyLlm.title: OpenAI

provider.description: Must be 'openai' when using the OpenAiLLM implementation.

base_url.description: Optional base URL for custom OpenAI-compatible endpoints.

OpenAiOnlyLlm.description: Use this schema when you want to lock the LLM provider to OpenAI only. The playground and generated docs will show only the 'openai' provider option for this schema.

provider.description: Provider selection for LiteLLM. This option exposes many providers (including 'custom') that map to the LiteLLM implementation in the backend.

model.description: Model identifier for the chosen provider.

Synthesizer.description: Text-to-speech synthesizer settings. Configure provider and runtime behavior for generating audio from agent responses.

x-mint.content:
Synthesizer fields (micro docs):

• provider — Select TTS provider.
• provider_config — Provider-specific options (voice, model, locale, etc.).
• stream — boolean, default true: enable streaming audio output (lower latency).
• buffer_size — integer: streaming buffer size (recommended ms: 100–500).
• audio_format — string: 'wav', 'mp3', 'ogg', 'opus', etc.
• caching — boolean: enable caching for deterministic outputs.

provider.description: Select the synthesizer provider. The chosen provider determines which keys are valid in provider_config and which features (streaming, sample rate, voice control) are available.

provider_config.description: Provider-specific configuration object. Use the matching provider schema from the oneOf list (e.g., PollyConfig, ElevenLabsConfig). These fields map directly to the TTS provider's API and may accept provider-specific keys such as voice_id, model, or locale.

stream.description: When true, synthesizer audio is produced in a streaming fashion (chunked RTP/HTTP streaming) rather than waiting for the full utterance to be generated. Streaming reduces perceived latency and allows early audio playback. If your chosen provider does not support streaming, the backend will fall back to non-streaming behavior.

buffer_size.description: Size of the audio buffer used during streaming or when assembling audio frames. Interpretation is provider-dependent; commonly this is a duration in milliseconds (ms) for streaming buffers, or a number of bytes/frames for some SDKs. Use conservative values to avoid choppiness (e.g., 100–500 ms). Always verify provider docs for exact unit semantics.

audio_format.description: Requested output audio format or container. Common values: 'wav' (PCM), 'mp3', 'ogg', 'opus'. Choose a format compatible with downstream telephony/clients. The backend may transcode if the provider does not natively emit the requested format.

caching.description: Enable caching of generated audio for identical input (same voice, model, and TTS parameters). When true, repeated identical responses can be served from cache to reduce cost and latency. Be aware of storage costs and cache invalidation rules; caching is typically safe for deterministic TTS outputs but not for truly dynamic responses.

Transcriber.description: Transcriber configuration. Supported providers: deepgram, whisper, azure, bodhi

x-mint.content:
Transcriber micro docs:

• provider — ASR engine.
• provider_config — Provider-specific config (model, settings).
• language — BCP-47 language tag (e.g., en-US).
• stream — boolean: enable streaming ASR.
• sampling_rate — expected audio sample rate in Hz.
• encoding — audio encoding type (linear16, opus, etc.).
• endpointing — silence endpointing window in ms.
• keywords — optional keywords to boost.
• task — ASR task hint (transcribe/translate).

provider.description: Select the ASR/transcription provider. Each provider may support different languages, models, and streaming capabilities.

provider_config.description: Provider-specific configuration for the chosen transcriber. See each provider schema (DeepgramTranscriberConfig, AzureTranscriberConfig, BodhiTranscriberConfig) for supported keys such as model and settings.

language.description: BCP-47 language tag (e.g., 'en-US'). Used to bias recognition models and improve accuracy for the call's language.

stream.description: If true, perform streaming transcription (partial intermediate transcripts delivered in real-time). Streaming mode lowers end-to-end latency but may incur more compute and different pricing on some providers.

sampling_rate.description: Audio sampling rate expected by the transcriber in Hz. Common telephony/VoIP rates: 8000, 16000. Use provider-supported rates to avoid resampling overhead.

encoding.description: Audio encoding/codec of the input audio (e.g., 'linear16' for PCM16). The backend may transcode if the input is different, but matching the provider's native encoding yields best performance.

endpointing.description: Endpointing window or silence detection threshold in milliseconds. Used to decide when an utterance is finished. Smaller values detect short pauses; larger values tolerate ambient noise.

keywords.description: Optional comma-separated keywords to boost recognition or to trigger events when detected. Provider support varies.

task.description: ASR task hint for providers that support specialized modes (e.g., 'transcribe', 'translate', 'diarize').

InputOutput.title: Telephony Input/Output
InputOutput.description:
Configure the telephony channel used for call audio (input or output). Commonly used with Twilio.
Note: provider is required.

x-mint.content:
Input/Output (quick reference):

• provider (required) — Telephony provider. Currently supported: 'twilio'.
• format — Preferred audio format (wav, mp3, pcm). Use 'wav' for best compatibility with ASR.

provider.description: Telephony provider handling call media and signaling. Currently only 'twilio' is supported. This field is required.

format.description: Requested audio container/encoding. Common values: 'wav' (PCM), 'mp3', 'mulaw'. The backend may transcode when needed.

ConversationConfig.title: Task Configuration (conversation)
ConversationConfig.description: High level call and LLM behaviour controls used per-task. Time values are in seconds unless noted otherwise.

x-mint.content:
Field reference (units in parentheses):

• optimize_latency (boolean) — default true — If true, prefer lower-latency responses.
• hangup_after_silence (seconds, integer) — Example: 120 — Seconds of continuous silence before auto-hangup.
• incremental_delay (milliseconds, integer) — Example: 100 — Buffering delay used during streaming responses.
• number_of_words_for_interruption (integer) — Example: 1 — Words needed to count as interruption.
• interruption_backoff_period (milliseconds, integer) — Example: 100 — Time window after interruption before resuming.
• hangup_after_LLMCall (boolean) — Example: false — Hang up immediately after LLM completes.
• call_cancellation_prompt (string) — Prompt to play when cancelling call.
• backchanneling (boolean) — Example: false — Enable short ack/backchannel messages to LLM.
• backchanneling_message_gap (seconds, integer) — Example: 5 — Seconds between backchannel messages.
• backchanneling_start_delay (seconds, integer) — Example: 2 — Delay before sending first backchannel message.
• ambient_noise (boolean) — Example: false — Enable ambient noise handling.
• ambient_noise_track (string) — Example: "call-center" — Name of ambient noise profile to use.
• call_terminate (seconds, integer) — Example: 90 — Max call duration after which system may end call.
• use_fillers (boolean) — Example: false — Allow agent to use filler words for naturalness.
• trigger_user_online_message_after (seconds, integer) — Example: 60 — When to check if user is online.
• check_user_online_message (string) — Example: "Hey, are you still there" — Message when checking presence.
• check_if_user_online (boolean) — Example: true — Enable presence checking.
• generate_precise_transcript (boolean) — Example: true — Request higher-fidelity transcripts (may affect cost).

Tips: Use seconds for high-level timeouts (hangup_after_silence, call_terminate). Use milliseconds for low-level streaming tuning (incremental_delay, interruption_backoff_period).

optimize_latency.description: If true, system will favor lower latency responses over completeness (may shorten LLM responses).

hangup_after_silence.description: Number of seconds of continuous silence before the system automatically hangs up the call.

incremental_delay.description: Delay (milliseconds) used for incremental audio buffering/processing during streaming LLM responses.

number_of_words_for_interruption.description: How many words a caller must say to be considered an interruption to the agent's speech.

interruption_backoff_period.description: Backoff period (milliseconds) after an interruption before resuming normal processing.

hangup_after_LLMCall.description: If true, hang up immediately after an LLM-originated call completion (useful for single-turn bots).

call_cancellation_prompt.description: A prompt played to the user when a call is cancelled or terminated by the system.

backchanneling.description: Enable backchanneling: short ack/breathe signals sent to the LLM to improve turn-taking.

backchanneling_start_delay.description: Seconds to wait before sending the first backchanneling message after LLM starts speaking.

ambient_noise.description: If true, the system will apply ambient-noise handling strategies (e.g., voice activity tuning).

ambient_noise_track.description: Name of ambient noise profile to use (affects VAD, thresholds).

call_terminate.description: Total call duration in seconds after which system may force-terminate the call.

use_fillers.description: If true, the agent may inject short filler words (e.g., 'uh', 'hmm') to sound more natural.

trigger_user_online_message_after.description: Seconds of no agent activity after which the system checks if the user is still online.

check_user_online_message.description: Message to play when checking if the user is still connected.

check_if_user_online.description: If true, the system will periodically verify user presence and optionally end the call.

generate_precise_transcript.description: If true the system requests a higher-fidelity transcript (may increase cost).

ToolFunction.description: Function-style API tool declaration. Use when exposing external APIs as callable functions to LLMs.

x-mint.content:
ToolFunction guidance:

• name — unique function name.
• description — human-readable summary used in prompts.
• parameters — JSON Schema for function arguments (follow JSON-function patterns).
• strict — when true, validate inputs strictly.

name.description: Unique function name used when the LLM selects this tool.

description.description: Human-readable description of what the API tool does. Used in playgrounds and prompts to help the LLM choose the correct tool.
description.example: Fetch recent orders for a customer by ID.

parameters.description: JSON Schema describing the function parameters. This should follow OpenAI/JSON-function style parameter specifications if using LLM function calling, including property names, types, required fields and descriptions.

strict.description: When true, the backend will enforce parameter validation and refuse calls that don't match the declared schema. When false, the tool may accept flexible or loosely-typed inputs (behavior is implementation-dependent).

APIParams.description: Parameters for configuring external API tool calls. Prefer secure storage for sensitive tokens and keys.

x-mint.content:
API Params quick reference:

• url — Full HTTPS endpoint to call (example provided).
• method — HTTP verb to use (GET/POST).
• param — Request payload: string for raw bodies or object for structured JSON.

url.description: Target URL for the API call. Use HTTPS whenever possible.

method.description: HTTP method used when calling the external API (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).

api_token.description: Optional API token or credential used when invoking the external API. For security, prefer passing tokens via secure storage or MCP servers rather than embedding in agent config.

param.description: Parameters/body to send to the API. Use a string for simple payloads or an object for structured JSON bodies. When using objects, additionalProperties are allowed for flexible mappings.

ToolModel.title: API Tools
ToolModel.description: Register external API tools that the agent can call. Tools can be declared inline or referenced by ID. Use tools_params to configure per-tool defaults and MCP servers to keep secrets off the agent payload.

x-mint.content:
API Tools micro docs:

• tools — array of function-style API tools (name, description, parameters).
• tools_params — map of tool name -> API call defaults (url, method, api_token, param).
• mcp_servers — list of MCP servers for secure token/credentials storage.
• api_tool_ids — references to pre-registered tools (string IDs).

Tip: prefer storing secrets in MCP servers and referencing them rather than embedding tokens in agent configs.

tools.description: List of function-style tools available to the agent. Each tool should define a unique name and parameter schema.

tools_params.description: Optional map of tool identifier to default API call parameters. Useful for configuring default URLs, methods, or tokens per tool.

mcp_servers.description: Optional list of MCP servers for secure credential or connection storage. Each entry should include 'url' and server-specific routing info.

api_tool_ids.description: IDs referencing pre-registered API tools in external registries or platform storage. Use when the tool definitions are stored outside this agent config.

call_transfer_config.description: Optional per-transfer configuration used when transferring calls to live agents.

call_transfer_description.description: Human readable text describing call transfer behavior for operators.

transfer_type.description: warm = consult then transfer, cold = direct transfer

extraction_json.description: JSON schema or mapping used by extractor

request_json.description: If true, pass raw request JSON to extractor

CallPayload.description: Payload for initiating an outbound call. Provide either an existing agent_id (to use a stored agent) or an inline agent_config with optional agent_prompts (to create a temporary agent for this call). NOTE: the UI previously rendered a separate 'Option' schema because the spec used a oneOf; to avoid showing Option 1/2 in the docs we do not use oneOf here — the server still expects one of these two fields to be present.

agent_id.description: Existing agent UUID to use for the call.

agent_config.description: Inline agent configuration for a temporary agent used only for this call.

agent_prompts.description: Optional inline prompts for a temporary agent.

sender_phone_number.description: Phone number to place the call from (E.164).

record.description: Whether the call should be recorded. Compliant agents may force this to false.

template_variables.description: Template variables available to agent prompts.

call_sid.description: Twilio Call SID to end (e.g. CA... ).
